issue.title: Yyyy
issue.body: https://www.firstdirect.com/online/#/authentication/username

issue.title: Set URI attribute with a fixed value
issue.body:
In
https://github.com/robrichards/xmlseclibs/blob/master/src/XMLSecurityDSig.php#L662
I needed to change the line to read
```$refNode->setAttribute("URI", '#'.$id_name)```
Because I was trying to reproduce an XML which has
```
  <attachment id="attachmentId">[data]</attachment>
```
and below
```<ds:Reference URI="#attachmentId">```

issue.title: No upload page due to HTML5, Flash, Silverlight error in r1605
issue.body:
Hi,

First of all: I am not a pro. Just try to get things done.
Then, the issue:

Thanks for the great work. I am super pleased with PS.

But..   after update to r1605 it is no longer possible in my older Firefox (52.x) browser to upload files. And a new FF-version won't work on my XP (ancient but I want to hang to to that one as long as I can).

The upload.php page shows the info text about how to upload. 
And then it says:
Your browser doesn't support HTML5, Flash or Silverlight. Please update your browser or install Adobe Flash or Silverlight to continue.

But that is not possible in the old Firefox 52.x

Tried with replacing the upload.php by the older one (r1295) but no use.
Also edit files (re-assign) is not possible as the form for selecting a client is missing.

Using PHP 8.0 as my host has changed his policy so returning to 7.4 and re-installing the old PS-version is not an option.

Is there a way to work around that error? Or is there a fix?

Kind regards,
Werner

issue.title: Translations during the installation step
issue.body:
Add a reference to https://www.projectsend.org/translations/index.php
or allow to download and unpack directly the installation package for the chosen language if rights are correct

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1304918/198333190-47761b02-1357-43ab-8340-8af610baa47b.png)

comment.body: Thanks, I saw you started a refactoring in another branch. Do you prefer I look at that one?

pull_request.title: Show Manage files only when user has option
pull_request.body:
Client with read only access should have only View my files option enabled in the menu, I saw there are different options for clients which relate to files so I listed all of them.

Fixes #1078 if I understood the comment

repo.name: projectsend
repo.description: ProjectSend is a free, open source software that lets you share files with your clients, focused on ease of use and privacy. It supports clients groups, system users roles, statistics, multiple languages, detailed logs... and much more!

repo.name: projectsend
repo.description: ProjectSend is a free, open source software that lets you share files with your clients, focused on ease of use and privacy. It supports clients groups, system users roles, statistics, multiple languages, detailed logs... and much more!

commits.message:
Show Manage files only when user has option

Client with read only access should have only View my files option enabled in the menu,
I saw there are different options for clients which relate to files so I listed all of them.

issue.title: Usage through Webpack: "Error: Can't resolve 'sifter'"
issue.body:
---

I did:

* [x] Search for if my issue has already been submitted
* [x] Make sure I'm reporting something precise that needs to be fixed
* [x] Give my issue a descriptive and concise title
* [ ] Create a *minimal* working example on JsFiddle or Codepen
	(or gave a link to a demo on the Selectize docs)
* [x] Indicate *precise* steps to reproduce in *numbers* and the result,
	  like below

[replace me with a short description of issue]

Steps to reproduce:

1. Install selectize
```
$ yarn add @selectize/selectize
yarn add v1.22.10
warning ../../../package.json: No license field
[1/4] Resolving packages...
[2/4] Fetching packages...
info fsevents@2.1.3: The platform "linux" is incompatible with this module.
info "fsevents@2.1.3" is an optional dependency and failed compatibility check. Excluding it from installation.
[3/4] Linking dependencies...
[4/4] Building fresh packages...
success Saved lockfile.
success Saved 12 new dependencies.
info Direct dependencies
└─ @selectize/selectize@0.13.6
info All dependencies
├─ @selectize/selectize@0.13.6
├─ @selectize/sifter@0.6.2
├─ ansicolors@0.3.2
├─ async@3.2.4
├─ cardinal@2.1.1
├─ csv-parse@5.3.0
├─ esprima@4.0.1
├─ humanize@0.0.9
├─ microplugin@0.0.3
├─ optimist@0.5.2
├─ redeyed@2.1.1
└─ wordwrap@0.0.3
Done in 8.33s.
```
2. Import selectize in the entrypoint
```
require("@selectize/selectize");
```
3. Run webpack bundle

Expected result:
Webpack bundle succeeds. This worked with version `0.12.6` from https://www.npmjs.com/package/selectize
Fails with `0.13.6` from https://www.npmjs.com/package/@selectize/selectize.

Actual result:

```
ERROR in ./node_modules/@selectize/selectize/dist/js/selectize.js
Module not found: Error: Can't resolve 'sifter' in '/home/fap/repos/project/com.vogella.project/node_modules/@selectize/selectize/dist/js'
resolve 'sifter' in '/home/fap/repos/project/com.vogella.project/node_modules/@selectize/selectize/dist/js'
  Parsed request is a module

    Field 'browser' doesn't contain a valid alias configuration

            no extension
              Field 'browser' doesn't contain a valid alias configuration
              /home/fap/repos/project/com.vogella.project/node_modules/@selectize/selectize/node_modules/sifter doesn't exist
            .js
              Field 'browser' doesn't contain a valid alias configuration

            .json

        /home/fap/repos/project/com.vogella.project/node_modules/@selectize/selectize/node_modules/sifter doesn't exist

            no extension

              /home/fap/node_modules/sifter doesn't exist

        /home/fap/node_modules/sifter doesn't exist
      /home/node_modules doesn't exist or is not a directory
      /node_modules doesn't exist or is not a directory
 @ ./src/main/resources/scripts/main.js 8:0-31
```

Sifter is installed in `project/node_modules/@selectize/sifter` but webpack looks for a `node_modules` folder directly containing sifter starting from `project/node_modules/@selectize/selectize`.

comment.body: I manually installed the old sifter to make it compile at the moment.

In
https://github.com/robrichards/xmlseclibs/blob/master/src/XMLSecurityDSig.php#L662

issue.title: No upload page due to HTML5, Flash, Silverlight error in r1605
issue.body:
Hi,

First of all: I am not a pro. Just try to get things done.
Then, the issue:

Thanks for the great work. I am super pleased with PS.

But..   after update to r1605 it is no longer possible in my older Firefox (52.x) browser to upload files. And a new FF-version won't work on my XP (ancient but I want to hang to to that one as long as I can).

The upload.php page shows the info text about how to upload. 
And then it says:
Your browser doesn't support HTML5, Flash or Silverlight. Please update your browser or install Adobe Flash or Silverlight to continue.

But that is not possible in the old Firefox 52.x

Tried with replacing the upload.php by the older one (r1295) but no use.
Also edit files (re-assign) is not possible as the form for selecting a client is missing.

Using PHP 8.0 as my host has changed his policy so returning to 7.4 and re-installing the old PS-version is not an option.

Is there a way to work around that error? Or is there a fix?

Kind regards,
Werner

              Field 'browser' doesn't contain a valid alias configuration
              /home/fap/node_modules/sifter.json doesn't exist
            .wasm
              Field 'browser' doesn't contain a valid alias configuration
              /home/fap/node_modules/sifter.wasm doesn't exist
        /home/fap/node_modules/sifter doesn't exist
      /home/node_modules doesn't exist or is not a directory
      /node_modules doesn't exist or is not a directory
 @ ./src/main/resources/scripts/main.js 8:0-31
```

Sifter is installed in `project/node_modules/@selectize/sifter` but webpack looks for a `node_modules` folder directly containing sifter starting from `project/node_modules/@selectize/selectize`.

comment.body: I manually installed the old sifter to make it compile at the moment.

issue.title: Yyyy
issue.body: https://www.firstdirect.com/online/#/authentication/username

issue.title: Set URI attribute with a fixed value
issue.body:
In
https://github.com/robrichards/xmlseclibs/blob/master/src/XMLSecurityDSig.php#L662
I needed to change the line to read
```$refNode->setAttribute("URI", '#'.$id_name)```
Because I was trying to reproduce an XML which has
```
  <attachment id="attachmentId">[data]</attachment>
```
and below
```<ds:Reference URI="#attachmentId">```

issue.title: No upload page due to HTML5, Flash, Silverlight error in r1605
issue.body:
Hi,

First of all: I am not a pro. Just try to get things done.
Then, the issue:

Thanks for the great work. I am super pleased with PS.

But..   after update to r1605 it is no longer possible in my older Firefox (52.x) browser to upload files. And a new FF-version won't work on my XP (ancient but I want to hang to to that one as long as I can).

The upload.php page shows the info text about how to upload. 
And then it says:
Your browser doesn't support HTML5, Flash or Silverlight. Please update your browser or install Adobe Flash or Silverlight to continue.

But that is not possible in the old Firefox 52.x

Tried with replacing the upload.php by the older one (r1295) but no use.
Also edit files (re-assign) is not possible as the form for selecting a client is missing.

Using PHP 8.0 as my host has changed his policy so returning to 7.4 and re-installing the old PS-version is not an option.

Is there a way to work around that error? Or is there a fix?

Kind regards,
Werner

issue.title: Translations during the installation step
issue.body:
Add a reference to https://www.projectsend.org/translations/index.php
or allow to download and unpack directly the installation package for the chosen language if rights are correct

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1304918/198333190-47761b02-1357-43ab-8340-8af610baa47b.png)

comment.body: Thanks, I saw you started a refactoring in another branch. Do you prefer I look at that one?

pull_request.title: Show Manage files only when user has option
pull_request.body:
Client with read only access should have only View my files option enabled in the menu, I saw there are different options for clients which relate to files so I listed all of them.

Fixes #1078 if I understood the comment

commits.message:
Show Manage files only when user has option

Client with read only access should have only View my files option enabled in the menu,
I saw there are different options for clients which relate to files so I listed all of them.

forkee.description: ProjectSend is a free, open source software that lets you share files with your clients, focused on ease of use and privacy. It supports clients groups, system users roles, statistics, multiple languages, detailed logs... and much more!

issue.title: Usage through Webpack: "Error: Can't resolve 'sifter'"
issue.body:
---

I did:

* [x] Search for if my issue has already been submitted
* [x] Make sure I'm reporting something precise that needs to be fixed
* [x] Give my issue a descriptive and concise title
* [ ] Create a *minimal* working example on JsFiddle or Codepen
	(or gave a link to a demo on the Selectize docs)
* [x] Indicate *precise* steps to reproduce in *numbers* and the result,
	  like below

[replace me with a short description of issue]

Steps to reproduce:

1. Install selectize
```
$ yarn add @selectize/selectize
yarn add v1.22.10
warning ../../../package.json: No license field
[1/4] Resolving packages...
[2/4] Fetching packages...
info fsevents@2.1.3: The platform "linux" is incompatible with this module.
info "fsevents@2.1.3" is an optional dependency and failed compatibility check. Excluding it from installation.
[3/4] Linking dependencies...
[4/4] Building fresh packages...
success Saved lockfile.
success Saved 12 new dependencies.
info Direct dependencies
└─ @selectize/selectize@0.13.6
info All dependencies
├─ @selectize/selectize@0.13.6
├─ @selectize/sifter@0.6.2
├─ ansicolors@0.3.2
├─ async@3.2.4
├─ cardinal@2.1.1
├─ csv-parse@5.3.0
├─ esprima@4.0.1
├─ humanize@0.0.9
├─ microplugin@0.0.3
├─ optimist@0.5.2
├─ redeyed@2.1.1
└─ wordwrap@0.0.3
Done in 8.33s.
```
2. Import selectize in the entrypoint
```
require("@selectize/selectize");
```
3. Run webpack bundle

Expected result:
Webpack bundle succeeds. This worked with version `0.12.6` from https://www.npmjs.com/package/selectize
Fails with `0.13.6` from https://www.npmjs.com/package/@selectize/selectize.

Actual result:

```
ERROR in ./node_modules/@selectize/selectize/dist/js/selectize.js
Module not found: Error: Can't resolve 'sifter' in '/home/fap/repos/project/com.vogella.project/node_modules/@selectize/selectize/dist/js'
resolve 'sifter' in '/home/fap/repos/project/com.vogella.project/node_modules/@selectize/selectize/dist/js'

    Field 'browser' doesn't contain a valid alias configuration

            no extension
              Field 'browser' doesn't contain a valid alias configuration
